segment.source: ms.ContentId: 95FE9554-3968-4EED-B65D-E03F06A7598D
segment.target: ms.ContentId: 95FE9554-3968-4EED-B65D-E03F06A7598D

segment.source: title: Step 3: Create a virtual switch
segment.target: title: Step 3: Create a virtual switch

segment.source: Step 3: Create a virtual switch
segment.target: Step 3: Create a virtual switch

segment.source: 12-Nov update.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.

segment.source: A virtual switch allows you to create a network connection for your virtual machine.
segment.target: A virtual switch allows you to create a network connection for your virtual machine.

segment.source: They are used just like the network adapter (NIC) on your physical computer.
segment.target: They are used just like the network adapter (NIC) on your physical computer.

segment.source: For this example, we are going to create an External switch.
segment.target: For this example, we are going to create an External switch.

segment.source: The external switch will allow your virtual machine to access the host machine's network adapter.
segment.target: The external switch will allow your virtual machine to access the host machine's network adapter.

segment.source: If your host machine is connected to the internet, your virtual machine will be as well.
segment.target: If your host machine is connected to the internet, your virtual machine will be as well.

segment.source: We'll also set the switch to allow the host to share this network adapter.
segment.target: We'll also set the switch to allow the host to share this network adapter.

segment.source: This makes it so both the virtual machines and the host can use the same network.
segment.target: This makes it so both the virtual machines and the host can use the same network.

segment.source: In Hyper-V manager, click Virtual Switch Manager.
segment.target: In Hyper-V manager, click Virtual Switch Manager.

segment.source: Select New virtual network switch.
segment.target: Select New virtual network switch.

segment.source: Select External and Create Virtual Switch.
segment.target: Select External and Create Virtual Switch.

segment.source: Under Name, type External.
segment.target: Under Name, type External.

segment.source: Under External network, select the correct network adapter (there will probably only be one option).
segment.target: Under External network, select the correct network adapter (there will probably only be one option).

segment.source: Select Allow management operating system to share this network adapter and click OK.
segment.target: Select Allow management operating system to share this network adapter and click OK.

segment.source: You'll get a message warning you that your network might disconnect while the virtual switch is created.
segment.target: You'll get a message warning you that your network might disconnect while the virtual switch is created.

segment.source: Just click Yes.
segment.target: Just click Yes.

segment.source: Your network will be unavailable for a short time.
segment.target: Your network will be unavailable for a short time.

segment.source: Next step:
segment.target: Next step:

segment.source: Step 4: Create a Windows virtual machine from an .iso file
segment.target: Step 4: Create a Windows virtual machine from an .iso file
